subject: RE: [junit] Experiencing problems with JUnit using the XML PArser
msgSnippet: Daniel, I believe you are experiencing the class loader problem that so many others (including me) have run across. Just search the archives of this mailing
messageBody:
Experiencing problems with JUnit using the XML PArser
Daniel,
 
I believe you are experiencing the "class loader" problem that so many others (including me) have run across. Just search the archives of this mailing list for "xml parser" (without the quotation marks) and I think you'll find what you need. There are several solutions; just pick the one that works best for your situation.
 
Thanks,
Peter
 

Peter Spitz
Team Leader/Senior Software Developer
InSystems Technologies
19 Allstate Parkway, Suite 400

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Mayor [mailto:d.mayor@...]
Sent: Friday, June 08, 2001 3:58 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Experiencing problems with JUnit using the XML PArser

Hi All

My name is Daniel Mayor and I'm responsible of the Java development group in my company.

We are building up an architecture XML-based, so all our methods have an XML API, similar to XML-RPC.

We are trying to use JUnit as a testing environment for our programs, but when we try to create a test the following error appears.

java.lang.LinkageError: Class org/xml/sax/InputSource violates loader constraints       at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)    at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:486)      at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:111)      at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:248)         at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(URLClassLoader.java:56)   at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:195)       at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)   at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188)   at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:297)        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:286)        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:253)        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:313)        at com.sun.xml.parser.InputEntity.init(InputEntity.java:133)    at com.sun.xml.parser.Parser.parseInternal(Parser.java:463)     at com.sun.xml.parser.Parser.parse(Parser.java:284)     at com.sun.xml.parser.DocumentBuilderImpl.parse(DocumentBuilderImpl.java:95)    at kfc.test.OperationTests.setUp(OperationTests.java:51)

So we can't create any test based on that XML class.

Any ideas about this error?

Regards.



Daniel Mayor

Dimensión Informática.
Avda Cataluña 9, Entlo. A
46020 Valencia.
